text: Went there for dinner tonight. Ate in the dining room. Don't ever go here if you are really hungry, cause the service is beyond mediocre and no food comes quickly. The people are nice enough, but are in no hurry to do anything quick for you, that includes bartenders, getting drinks, plates cleared, getting food.....the food is alright,  drinks were tasty, but the poor service ruined the experience

Without a doubt, the worst food I have ever eaten.  Ordered linguine with clam sauce and chicken parmesan.  The clam sauce obviously came out of a can.  The chicken parmesan was cold and the pasta looked like it was left over from someone else's dinner.  The female bartender on Thursday told us the food was fantastic.  We came back on Saturday and I will never go back to Dean's Place................that's how bad the food tasted.  Even Burger King makes a better chicken parmesan, so you know it had to be pretty disgusting.

My husband and I stopped at this place on our way to Red Rock canyon. Being Dean Martin fans, we were also curious. When we entered the place, we were greeted warmly by the staff. Our server, Edna, was incredible. She was so nice and attentive to us! I ordered a custom made calzone and my husband had a Philly Cheesteak sandwich. The bread is made fresh daily as are all the sauces. One bite of my calzone and I was in heaven. It was by far the BEST calzone I have ever eaten! The bread was perfectly cooked, the ingredients were fresh and tasty as was the mozzarella cheese. It was so good in fact that we came back the next day!! There were many wonderful items on the menu but I had to have the calzone. My husband thoroughly enjoyed his sandwich and the breakfast the next day. They also make all their sausages in house. I cannot say enough about this place. On our way out of town, Edna was kind enough to supply us with cold bottled water for our trip. She definitely went above and beyond and even told us some history about Las Vegas. When we return to Las Vegas, we will definitely stop in again at Dean's Place. If you go, ask for Edna. She will treat you right.

When one of my friends suggested meeting here for drinks instead of my usual favorite hangouts, i.e. Yardhouse in Town Center, I was skeptical. After all, I live in Henderson, and the only time I've ventured near Blue Diamond is when I'm taking 15 South to head towards L.A. Anything outside of the 215/15 intersection tends to be pushing my comfort zone! However, I am never one to turn down the possibility of finding a potentially new favorite hangout place. This place wasn't bad though. My vodka tonics were strong and only $4 a piece. Food wasn't bad either. My friend ordered the Italian Wedding soup, which was decent. I got the fried mozzarella, which of course is the *perfect* drunchie food. The service was good, and it's actually the perfect place to just hang out, relax, and talk. I'd go here again.

Well this is my second review of deans place. They have changed their menu and pricing not for the better. They now charge more fir dinners and don't include soup or salad anymore not good. I don't think we will be coming back because of this, my wife and I have been coming for years and now we just decided never again. I hope the management takes note and puts back the choices and the menu. I recognize that food cost has gone up but not that much. SO GOOD LUCK YOU HAVE LOST A WEEKLY CUSTOMER, not returning unless you change your ways....    
the sevice is good so not our servers fault...

So I live near Deans Place, hence the reason I would try this establishment after living here for 10 years.  Desperation and/or out of options near home.  I went for ribs night...the ribs are not good/overcooked and service was aweful.  I would have accepted 1 without the other based on venue and pricing.  The other 2 items ordered were fine, good for bar food.  Summary...I won't be back and would only recommend visiting if intoxicated AND walking home .  I really wanted to find a hidden  gem, but instead I found exactly what I had feared for many years.

We received a coupon in the mail and  we are moving down the street from this place. We wanted to check it out. The food was pretty good. Ordered lasagna. Good prices. Then, we hit up the bar for some video poker and came out $150 up. The place was really clean and very nice and friendly staff. We will probably be back a lot in the future. It was fun!
Go ahead and drive on by this place is not very good I can't imagine that this place will be open more than a year from now save your money go somewhere good

I wanted to try this place for a long time. I live very close to the Silverton Hotel and have passed it by several times. I clip a few of their coupons and have seen their Billboards all over the place. I finally stopped in for some grub. Well I was thinking yucky bar food! However I happen to hop in on a night that they were doing a 7 course wine tasting and to my surprise they have an extensive Italian Menu. I sat at the bar, look around and saw that others were eating at the bar. Struck up a conversation with another patron and he suggested trying the Lasagna. The Salad and the dressings were good, the server/Bartender allowed me to try the soup which was Jalapeno corn chowder. It was too rich for me but I took some home for my husband and he loved it and wanted me to go back and get some more. The Lasagna was tasty but the food should have been hotter. It was very tasty but I did mention the lack of heat on it and she offered to heat it up but I kindly refused due to my paranoia. I did lose $40 in the machine but she comp my meal feeling bad that is was not hot enough. I left her a $20 tip and we parted ways. I want to go back with my husband and try it again as this point. See you there soon.

Sari

Dean's place is Damn good.  They have on fridays, all you can eat ribs.  The meat peels off the bone and real tender.  Can't wait to try their Italian dishes.  I'll bet I won't be disappointed. I recommend it to others about this place.

Have always driven by but never took the time to try them out. Have always heard good things so today was the day. I ordered the Chicken Parmesan and it was fabulous. We had the mozzarella sticks as an appetizer and they provide complimentary rolls. Highly recommend.

Dean's was nothing special.  I guess the location on Dean Martin Drive and the one picture of Dean Martin in the entryway are what makes it "Dean's" Place.

It's billed as an Italian restaurant; there's Italian aplenty (chicken piccata, eggplant parm, Italian sausage sandwich, etc.) but there's a lot of American influence as well (burgers, pulled pork).  The food is fine, portions are a good size, and the prices are reasonable.  

The service is slooooooooooooooow.  The restaurant was nowhere near busy the night we were there, but it took our server forever and a day to bring our drinks.  I thought she'd gotten lost on the way to our table.  A couple that was seated fifteen minutes after we were received their food ten minutes before we did.   

There are several TVs in this place, all playing sports, so it feels more like a sports bar than a restaurant.

Fairly new to the Las Vegas area and haven't tried nearly enough restaurants but know a lot about restaurants in general. The atmosphere is very casual and calm. Plenty of TVs in the bar area and a friendly staff. What brings me back though is a few of the menu items. Namely the Fish and Chips and their amazing Prime Rib Dip Sandwich! OMG, a must try if you are a French dip fan. The fish and chips get the same review from me, a MUST try! As far as I know almost all their menu items are homemade including their desserts, lasagna, dressings and even some awesome Italian sausage! A bit out of the way, you will feel like a foodie guide bringing people here, who otherwise  would never have known. Deans has gone through some staff in the last few years and seem to have found a great group of people who really care about giving a customer a great experience.  Overall a wonderful dining experience!

The food and the service were bad. We watched our waitress argue with the other wait staff over whose turn it was to do their job. After that we heard the bartender informing everyone at the bar about the DUI checkpoint so they didn't drive home that way. We finally get our food my pizza was over done and my husbands sandwich was a white bun with lunch meat. It was something you'd expect from a school cafeteria. The behavior of the staff alone is enough to keep me from returning to this restaurant.

The service was very good. The food was delicious. I went at during lunch and ordered the Spaghetti and Meatballs. This lunch came with a salad and your choice of several homemade dressings. I had the Ranch. The dressing was very good. Fresh baked bread was also served with a dish of olive oil and vinegar. I will return!

As of the date I wrote this article, you can print out a coupon for a buy one/ get one free entree here:
http://www.print2webcorp.com/mkt/lvmainpub200/smedia/View.aspx?i=1651186&e=47533
I love going there to chill and hang out. The atmosphere is laid back and its a "Cheers" from the 80's. Great food too. All around one of the best

Deans place takes care of their guests !
Great food great drinks, the staff and management are top notch! It's so nice to be in a family owned and run place in this ever growing Metropolis.  See Jack, Teddy and Jessica and if you Want great food late and night see Nick for the best food in Las Vegas

Our bartender was Carl and he was On Point! The whole venue was very clean and the food and drinks were great. Anything we needed was taken care of and even though it was pretty busy, Carl gave awesome service.  I will definitely come back.
 P.S the Reuben is great
We were looking forward to trying this place before a big bike ride.  We walked in and it was not busy.  We were ignored and no service for 10 minutes.  Would not return.

I love this place! I go there with locals when I'm in town and it's always excellent, both food and service. Last time I was there, I ordered the Capellini Pomodoro and it was superb. The pasta was done to perfection and the tomatoes were fresh and sweet. It totally surpassed my expectations. It was fresh from the garden just like my grandma used to make. I highly recommend Dean's Place for breakfast too!
The food was very average. There was nothing special about it. The service was attentive. As this place has a bar inside as well, be prepared to walk thru some smoke before you get to the restaurant.

Yelp reviews seem to favor this restaurant so we gave it a try. In a word: Unimpressed. Las Vegas is known for great Italian food but this place ain't one of them. It's ok: as in the same category as Macaroni Grill chains. The service was ok - but considering the restaurant was empty at 5:30 pm with the bar having a few bar top gamblers , there shouldn't have been a challenge there. There are better choices elsewhere.
Nothing Fancy, but the best real burgers in town
Not bad Italian, regular but good. I would come back if I was around. The pasta and chicken entrees where def more impressive then the BBQ slider appetizers

Great food, I come for the spaghetti meatballs .  But I also enjoy 5 dollar taquitos, steaks are also well prepared.  It is a step above a normal gaming bar in terms of food and service. There is a separate dinning room, smoking bar and a smoke free gaming bar as well.   Service is prompt and courteous.  I am not a regular but have been made to feel very welcome on three visits.  Karen gave me great service in the smoke free bar.

JUST called and spoke to a girl who so rudely hung-up on me. Great customer service skills.. lol good thing I called before going! Skip that place like rope. No wonder they have 3 stars. Hopefully now it's 2.5
Came for an Army retirement thing and tried some food. Wasn't too appealing to me so I just stuck with the beer. Not a lot of great choices on beer either.

Stopped in on the way home last night.  Had heard mixed reviews, but got a personal recommendation from a friend, so had to check it out for myself.

Sat at the bar and had a few cocktails and ordered some appetizers.  Apart from the delicious food, the service was fantastic.  We caught the day shift bartender at the end of his shift, and spent another hour or so with the swing bartender.  Both were friendly and engaging!  Great service!  Our waiter was equally friendly and courteous.  He spent some extra time chatting and getting to know us, as the dining crowd was pretty small at the time we were there.

Overall, this place is pretty great and has officially been added to my list of regular haunts!

Decided to try out a new place. Kept seeing signs of all-you-can-eat ribs on Wednesdays. The ribs were delicious! Meat was falling off the bones. Fettuccini Alfredo was also very good. Definitely will be coning back here again.

Food was ok, we had the calamari for the appetizer which was really good. The major disappointment for the night was the fact that we were eating in an Italian restaurant yet the bread served to us was sourdough. I know bread is not the most important thing but an oversight like that led me to believe that maybe everything else wasnt going to be up to snuff. Had the lasagna which was pretty good and can't recall what my wife had. Waitresses seemed pre-occupied and didn't seem like they wanted to be there. I would try it again and hope for better but wouldn't tell anyone to drive out of their way for this.
Have been twice and last night got their rib special. The service was very good and food tasted great. I would recommend!

The food is always good. Nice wine selection. Clean restaurant. Bartenders- Stephanie, Karen and Carl are great! It's close to our house, so we go quite a bit. Only reason why not 5 stars is last night we were there at 7pm for the all you can eat ribs and they were already gone.

I heard about the ribs special on Wednesday nights (all you can eat ribs plus the usual sides for the very reasonable price of $19 - such a deal!). We were in the neighborhood with friends and had to give it a try. The ambiance is "local bar/restaurant" - think Winchells or PTs. Very basic, no tablecloths, lots of TVs with sports running. 
When we arrived, we were the only ones in the dining area (there is a walled off bar area that is very separate). As soon as we sat, our server, Sara, came by to explain the special and take our drink order. My wife and I each got the ribs. My buddy went with the spaghetti and meatballs. The portions are huge! My buddy loved the spaghetti and meatballs. Also a very large portion and very tasty. In addition to the full rack of ribs, my order came with a very large portion of fries (done perfectly), beans, slaw, and corn bread. The ribs were fall off the bone tender with a sweet bbq sauce. Yumm. The corn bread also excellent. Way too much food for me to finish even the first serving, let alone take advantage of "AYCE" (I guess one portion was all I could eat).
Next time here, the wife and I will share a serving of ribs and forgo the unlimited refills. Even with 2 of us working on it, we wouldn't finish it all.

Lots of negative reviews, but I had a fine dining experience. As usual, it starts with the bartender (in the non-smoking section). She was very nice and so was the pig-tailed server. It was about 8pm on a Wednesday and I was looking for the UNLV game. The staff was quite helpful and found the game after a few minutes (They have every freakin channel if you need to watch a game). Meal started off great with hot Rosemary bread served with butter and balsamic and olive oil mix. Usually that is a good sign. Entree came with a large salad loaded with croutons and some of the biggest Cherry Tomatoes I have ever seen (i needded a knife to cut the 2nd one after the first one exploded in my mouth). Dressing was homemade Vinegarette and was getting full already. For the main shot, i tried the Chicken Picatta - something I don't usually get, but i was trying to avoid cheese. You need to like Capers andlemon sauce, but that is what Picatta usually consists of. Two large chicken breasts were tasty and then they even included a large side dish of pasta (( i had angel hair and marinara). All of this for $11.95. Oh yeah and a slice of garlic Bread to boot. 
     Some of menu is all over the place (south of the Border specialities?), but stay with Italian basics and if it seems like too much is going on with a dish skip it. Oh yeah, Dean Martin has nothing to do with this place, I think he named it after the road.

Thought I'd try this as my more local Italian place was closed today. Garlic bread is not. It's just rolls with old cheese melted on top. Meatballs have absolutely no flavor whatsoever. They drizzled Alfredo sauce on my manicotti. Didn't care for the extra calories. The restaurant area has an overwhelming smell of air freshener to cover up the old stale cigarette smell from the bar area. I won't go back.

Years ago when this place opened it had decent food. Now the food is so so. Italian food recipes not that great. Service has varied, last and final time A big NO. Employees don't seem to like each other that much either, and it's obvious. The place also needs to be remodeled, it's seen better days, feels like you're sitting inside of a cafeteria. Luckily, there's tons of other places around the area now, so you do have other choices. Management doesn't seem to really care either. it's basically a smoky local bar.

The manager and bartenders at this place are top notch!  Incredible food and phenomenal service.  Highly recommend!  And they have nightly food specials that are scrumptious!  If you are in Vegas, make the trip here!  Totally worth it!
One of my favorite places to eat! Nice people, warm atmosphere,  great food , last but not least awesome music

I have eaten here many years ago, had a pasta dish and was unimpressed. But that was years ago and I figure I would give it another try. It was worse than I remembered. I recently had the penne ala vodka and it was some of the worst I ever had. The sauce had absolutely no taste. Neither did the chicken I added to it. Bland is an understatement. Even the roll that came with it was sweet and is not the kind of bread that should be served with pasta. I haven't tried their non Italian dishes but if they're anything like this I'd stay away
Went for lunch with my husband he had the meatball sub, I had wedding soup and scampi appetizer.  Loved it!

Can't beat the Wednesday All-You-Can-Eat Ribs. They are fall off the bone good. Only down side is that it can be VERY loud in the dining area. The only quiet place is in the smoking section. Acoustics make it worse I think. The last two times I went there I left with a headache cause of noise. Which is unfortunate because I love their food.

Awesome food One of the best sports bars I've been to.  Lots of high definition TVs and a separate area for eating.  Very family-friendly! Make sure you ask for Carl. Great bartender with excellent customer service.

Loved our bartender... Manager sucked! 
We were having a blast in the smoke-free bar when the manager told us we were too loud for the 4 ppl in the restaurant... Sorry... We were having fun in your bar!!!!! We can go some where else to do that. Thanks Kristen, love u, had a blast!!!!!!

Another fantastic meal. Dean's is a must go to, everytime we come to Vegas. It is a bit out of the way but well worth it. I really like the fact that they have 2 bars and 2 dining rooms, one smoking and one non-smoking.    
I had the Cappelli Pomodoro. It is obviously made fresh, and it is amazing. I had the rest for breakfast this morning.
Needed a good place to eat and this fit the bill.  Great food and prompt service.  Especially away from the craziness of the usual places in town.  Check it out and you will be happy.

Excellent service & Tasty! YES...YES...
BREAKFAST - I appreciate my coffee always being full. Steak & Eggs, cooked to perfection & yes...they can make a sunnyside up eggs!
Try the BYO = build your own Omlette...plenty of combinations choose from!
LUNCH - Returned for the friendly service - once again we were truly taken care of! 
Bacon wrapped shrimp - big & juicy......Prime rib sandwich cooked to my liking! Bbq Pulled pork with a side of coleslaw. Philly Cheesesteak & try...try...try the Pasta salad - deliciousness!
Full bar straight in & dinning area to the right. 
- Open 24 hrs.
From a family of carnivores!

I've been coming to Deans for many years since it opened. Admittedly the food isn't as good as it was when Deano was the Chef, but I like coming here because it has always been a welcoming place with friendly regulars. I love listening to the old school music they play and relaxing with a beer. Usually when we eat here, we come for breakfast on the weekend. The service is usually good and the Saturday breakfast is always well prepared and tastes really good. Another good meal is the ribs on Wednesday. They are really tasty and come with beans, coleslaw and corn bread which is also really good. The pizza is also pretty good and they have a pretty good beer selection.

Good food and service. I al have had the ribs and Cobb salad. Both were very good. The staff was friendly and the place is clean and well Maintained. There are 2 seating areas and the bar. So you have good choices for were your party clean enjoy a meal.

Typical, Vegas bar food and atmosphere.  Everything was fine, but nothing was outstanding.  

It is nice that they support local clubs including the Mustang owners club, but not enough wait staff to handle the group.

I do not normally review too many things, but I felt the 3 stars for Dean's Place was not justified. It is a really good find behind the Silverton. The restaurant is really nice inside and has two dining rooms and a smoking bar in the middle. 

I love their Chicken Parm and it reminds me of being back east (originally from Northern New Jersey). A very generous portion and reasonably priced. The salad is really fresh as well. I have had other Italian dishes that were good as well. 

Great customer service, nice people. Sway in to Dean's Place, I think you will be glad you did.
I have nothing but good to say about this place,, the food is like mama used to make and delicious. Great staff great management. I recommend this place to all Italian food lovers.

Located very close to the Silverton hotel and casino off Blue Diamond and Dean Martin Drive, this local's style bar and restaurant is a surprise in the desert! Just a few months old and very well appointed. A huge bar and plenty of gaming machines on top will provide lots of gambling action. Friendly bartenders and wait staff. The food is out of this world and can range from juicy hamburgers to a full on Italian feast! Great pizza, salads, pasta and the list goes on. My friend ordered some chicken fingers and when the platter came out, I re-named it chicken HANDS not finger. The portions were HUGE and very tasty! (they did not last long). The menu features classic Italian dishes cooked to order. A nice selection that will have you saying, "Mama Mia!" There are 2 seperate dining areas located on both sides of the bar, so you can have a nice sit down dinner as well. Plenty of dining space for large and small parties. Dont forget the nice patio dining as long as weather permits. Try Dean's place soon, now thats amore!

Stopped here early Sunday afternoon and had their chicken marsala and friend had chicken parm. Finally very good Marsala. It's hard to find but found it here. Chicken parm was also delicious. Sauce was very tasty. 
Also got large salads and hot yeast buns with the meal. Definitely will be back.
Service was first class.

Visited Deans Place last weekend and the food was awesome. We ordered pizza, chicken parmigiana, burgers and fettuccine. It was great! It was the best chicken parmigiana I have ever had plus our waitress was awesome. Great place to eat at if you are in town.

I really wanted to like this place; my husband and I have been on a search for a really good Italian place in Vegas close by to where we live.  I've eaten there three times now, and I have to give a mediocre review.  
First off, the bread they serve with the dinner's is plain awful.  Not a really good, fresh baked regular Italian loaf like I expected, but a white bread with what I believe was tons of strong fennel baked inside it.  I about gagged, and the five other people I have eaten there also didn't like it.  So that was a disappointing start to our meal.  
Fried cheese appetizer was pretty good, but honestly is a bit hard to screw up in my opinion.
I ordered the fettucine alfredo, and my husband the spaghetti and meatballs.  On one good note, my husband really loved the spaghetti and meatballs and their Italian wedding soup.  But I ordered the fettucine alfredo, and I have to say it was the WORST I've ever eaten!  It had absolutely no flavor, and was the blandest sauce ever.  I had to send it back.
Second time, we tried their pizza.  Not too bad, only down side is I have this pet peeve about chunky sauce in my pizzas, and their sauce there is chunky, and that's what's used in the pizza.  I know a lot of people probably don't care about that, but I do, so a negative in my opinion.
But the third time we ate there with my mother and sister and law.  They both ordered the lasagna, and both about gagged on it.  Couldn't put a finger on it, and maybe it was spoiled, but both said it was disgusting.  Sent it back, telling them it was just plain gross and perhaps spoiled, but the waitress said it had been made the night before....but who knows.  The waitress that time was very friendly and gave us free cheesecake because of it, which was not too shabby at all.

Overall, because of the two times in a row somebody in my party has had to actually return dishes to the kitchen ( and I honestly cannot remember the last time I had food that bad at any restaurant so not like it's a habit!) and the crappy bread to begin the meal, I really can only give Dean's Place two stars, and the only reason that high is because my husband really enjoyed the spaghetti and meatballs and wedding soup.  As for me, I'm not in any hurry to go back there!

This place is conveniently located near the TA station so a lot of Truckers frequent this spot. The Italian wedding soup and Bruschetta were decent. The AYCE ribs were tender because they are boiled before baked. Not a fan of this but they were ok.

The first time we came here was awful because the waiter was rude but i found out from them that they have let him go so i have gone back to this place twice already after that and im glad i did. The food is very good and the working staff were very friendly. I went here midnight after watching a show and one Sunday morning for brunch. In both times, they have provided good food and good service. I especially like their eggplant parm sandwich but all of their meals were really delicious.

The sign outside reads GAMBLERS EAT FREE but the bartender must have not got the message.  Me and my boyfriend dropped around $400 into their poker games over the course of a half hour and yet somehow we were presented with a bill for $25.00 for our meal.  

If you want to squeeze every penny out of me, I will be more than happy to take my business elsewhere.

And as for the food, the shrimp scampi that came to me cold and raw.  I'll let you know if my stomach incurs permanent injury.
Came to deans place for a late night cocktail and snack, Kristen was very helpful and welcoming, Jack the manager came in early and shared the same hospitality.... Will definitely come again
Went for a business lunch and it was a great choice. Excellent lunch. Good food, service and quite so we could talk shop. Will be back.

Myself and my wife stumbled on this place one nite. It's across from the Silverton Casino. 
The first time I went there I was blown away. I thought the service and food was great. I'm from south philly and we know good food.
We had a problem with our food 4 times in one night. But it's sad that the owner could not come to the table and apologize for our inconvenience we experience.
This was about a year ago. We've been there 3 Other times since our first visit and it went down real quick. We found out they changed their cook and believe me you can taste the difference. The portions got smaller and the prices went up! This place is not even good no more for an appetizer. We brought my mom there with her boyfriend from Philly and it was just embarrassing. Nice place and great staff but the food went down hill fast. Don't waist your time. I have gave it 2 thumbs down not two stars.

I visited Dean's Place for the first time on a friend's recommendation. A GOOD friend! Dean's is quite a nice place - we arrived at 2:30 on a Sunday afternoon and this being our first visit, we started to order dinner,  which is not available until 4pm. No problem, they served us dinner, anyway - most accommodating! Food is VERY good. The Italian meals came with soup or salad (we chose salad). My husband was impressed that the lettuce was torn into bite-size peices. My dish came with olives and they were pitted! It's little details like this which make this restaurant special. Service was outstanding with our beverages being constantly replenished. Too bad we didn't have room for dessert - they looked great. Next time we'll definitely save room. And there WILL be a next time even though it's quite a drive for us. We can't wait to try the lunch menu. The Buy One Entree, Get the 2nd Free coupon appears every Wednesday in the LVRJ. Enjoy!
It was just alright.  Nothing too special.  The garlic knots are fantastic though.

I don't know what happened to this place. It used to be a great place to get delicious Italian food, but has turned into anything but that! Called to get take out for 3 people because my wife was craving Caprese salad. This used to be the main menu item that had us coming back. Turns out they don't have any mozzarella cheese!!! For real!? Disappointed, we still wanted some chicken Marsala, so we decided to order anyway. This was a huge mistake! Among it tasting completely different, and worse, from previous visits, they put it on a bed of pasta. In the past the pasta used to come as a side and allowed you to choose the type of noodles, as well as, the type of sauce you desired. We also asked for spaghetti with a meatball and got spaghetti with meat sauce! Anyone with kids knows it's hard enough to get them to eat, let alone, something they didn't want. To top it all off, they tried to fit 3 meals, 2 salads and bread all into 1 bag! Of course it spilled in the car! Last visit for sure!

Food looked appetizing but was so darn bland!!!! Service was rude,slow,unfriendly,not welcoming,unhelpful and totally unapologetic!!!

I got the Cappelini Pasta topped with basil,tomatoes and cheese. The dish was $12.95 but I added shrimp to it which added $3.00. = $15.95 The BF got the Penne Pasta with Vodka sauce $13.00.  When I told the waitress about how bland our food was - her responce was "Well, you have salt on your table - you could add that" - My reply- Excuse me - for the price I'm paying I shouldn't have to add salt for some sort of flavor.

The bruschetta was edible but did not look anything like the picture of bruschetta on their picture menu   T.V. that they have playing. Our meals came with soup or salad- we both opted for salad- Edible-

My daughters fettucini was bleh - hungry child ate it-

The waitress told me that every cook is different and some cooks just cook better than others- she asked me if I wanted anything else - so I asked her for the menu- she gave me the menu and I told her that I didn't have much time cause of my kid's practice near by - she said it shouldn't take that long.

After informing the waitress that I was running late for my child's practice and that I was not going to order anything else she rudly picked up both our uneaten bland dishes and kicked open the door to the bar while taking a big breath as she was walking away saying "OK hmm let's see what can be done about this" 


After about 10minutes of waiting for her to take my order she finally came out and instead of taking my order first she took another tables order (4 orders) so of course that meant I wasn't going to be able to eat- she ignored my hand gesture to come over to my table - she went to the back - then appeared out of no where with the check showing me that she took off the 2 bland orders but instead charged me for the salads that we both ate - OMG!!!!!


Umm the salads were a freakin given - they came with our horrible meal - we would have never ordered a small plate of salad for about $6.00 each anyways- the waitress could totally tell that we weren't happy but she didn't give a crap - no manager came out - no comp meal - no offering of a free dessert - no nothing- 
Now I'm not looking for free handouts but come on you want customers coming back after such an unpleasant experience don't you??.... Am I right??

At the end of this whole experience our waitress finally said these 2 words"I'M SORRY" Those 2 words should have came out of her mouth a long time ago - I quickly caught on to the fact that she wasn't sorry she was just working for her tip-

Here's my tip - learn how to smile, learn how to say Hello, learn how to be compationate to your customers needs and concerns because without us customers- you my dear would not get a paycheck- learn how to go that extra mile for your customer because it only benefits yourself!!!

Bottom line is that even though there were only 2 other people in the dining area no one paid attention to us and when the waitress did come around and we had a request/concern she acted like we were bothering her - she looked like she hated her job - Honey, that's not the customers problem!!

And to think as we were sitting looking at our menus before all this crap happened we were thinking of coming here for Valentines dinner -

I work pretty close to Dean's Place, and have found that this is one of the more quiet locations to have a business meeting or lunch with friends in the area. As far as the first impression, it is pretty similar to the hundreds of bar & grill type establishments in the valley. They offer a separate gaming area, and have a non-smoking dining area and second bar/dining area without gaming. 
First impressions aside, the food is quite good. Much of the items are made from scratch or have fresh made components (salad dressing, pasta sauce, etc...) My favorites include their grilled cheese (on marbled rye) and their pasta. I've also had their pizza, which was good as well, but only had that once. 
I almost exclusively visit at lunch, and on almost ever visit it takes more  than an hour to get in and out. This is an issue and would stop me from giving four stars. 
I have also had decent service and and not so decent service, but find that other than the leisurely nature of the servers, they tend to be friendly and helpful.

After seeing the lights of this establishment, while visiting Silverton, my curiosity finally got the better of me and I decided to try it.  The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is it really doesn't have any atmosphere.  Now, that's not a huge consideration when you have good food and superb service (Sara rules!).  I had the eggplant parm.  It was quite delicious.  I enjoyed the red sauce and it had a ton of melty cheese.  It came with a side of pasta.  You can choose the type of pasta and the type of sauce.  Some sauces are extra (i.e. vodka) so be aware of that.  There was more than enough food for $12 ($15, with the sauce upgrade).  My friend and I had a great meal at a great price and loved that it was casual (our two previous dinners were at fancier places--with fancier prices and dress codes).   I will be going back there for sure.

my fiance and I stumbled upon Dean's place by accident when we were hungry and starting to get tired before a long drive back to LA. I have to say it was the best place to end up. The Lasagna was really good, my fiance had a huge club sandwich and everything tasted really fresh. Its not gourmet, but its definitely tasty comfort food. The server was really sweet and Jack the Mgr was great too making sure we were taken care of. I will eat at Dean's place next time I am in Vegas.

After driving past this place for years, I finally stopped in for lunch. It wasn't very busy, but the place was clean and welcoming and we were greeted in a friendly manor.

I ordered the Reuben sandwich and it was outstanding. The perfect texture and it melted in my mouth. I would highly recommend this sandwich here.

Our waiter was very friendly and helpful.

All in all it was a great experience.
Awesome Italian food. Reasonably priced. Homemade ricotta, bread, balsamic. Great service.

When we walked in it was very confusing whether to go left or right. We ended up sitting in the bar area where there were 4 other people excluding us and the staff. After reading the reviews we were skeptical about eating here but we gave it a shot and glad we did. We were immediately helped by a nice waitress and got out food within 15-20 minutes of ordering. The portions were huge and the food was delicious but we were staying in a hotel so we didn't have any way of taking leftovers. Even though it seems slow, everything was great and I'm glad we found this place. I work at an Italian restaurant back at home and I'm glad I found this place because this is my new favorite place to eat! Once I move back, I'll definitely be returning here.
I had the spaghetti and meatballs and it was not good. They are advertise the meatballs as homemade but they had no flavor and tasted frozen.   The sauce had no flavor.   I would not go back.

More than a pub...and less than a casino...DEAN'S PLACE is in between and it is great...

You have a classy atmosphere (marble countertops and high beam ceilngs) plus super food 24/7 and gaming in two seperate bar areas...

One of the bars is totally non-smoking...Plus there is a huge restaurant area so that you don't have to sit at a bar to eat...

The staff is tip top and overall it is so easy to reach...Just off Blue Diamond on Dean Martin...

Take the turn to the Silverton and instead of turning into the parking lot stay straight on Dean Martin around the curve and you're at DEAN's PLACE...

Anytime...you can't go wrong when you meet your crowd at DEAN's...

Enjoy!

Went there on 10/9 for all-you-can-eat ribs night, and they ran out of ribs at 7:30pm! Really? Sounds quite unprepared. We got one order of ribs, then were told that they were out. We weren't even offered a discount! On top of it, the servers were slow. DO NOT GO!

My wife and I had been wanting to go to Dean's Place for months.  We eat out 3-5 times a week, many times at places we have a coupon for or they have a dining or happy hour special.  Dean's has been running a coupon in the Vegas paper, the RJ, for quite some time for buy an entree and get one free.  Every week I would tear one out in anticipation of going.

We decided to go last Monday.  Unfortunately, we could not find one of coupons immediately so my wife got on the Internet.  On the newspaper's website where we get the coupons from, in a section entitled the "RJ Marketplace", was a Dean's coupon.  We printed it out and zoomed over there.  We normally eat at the bar and play video poker, but it was smoky in there for dining so we went to the smoke-free dining room.  

I need to preface this as my wife and I are both former wait-people.  We are VERY critical of servers/wait people.  I also was a bartender, bar manager, restaurant manager, owner and operator of a restaurant, and a restaurant consultant.  

Our server, Victoria, was exceptional.  She quickly greeted us after we sat down, said she would be with us shortly.   She came back, asked us if we had ever been to Dean's Place and why we had decided to come there.  Jointly, my wife and I said "the coupon".  I did mention I liked their radio ads and it sounded like a place we could have fun eating, drinking, and gambling at.  

We ordered a fairly-priced bottle of wine.  Victoria again engaged in small talk that was not your everyday "is it hot outside" sort of dribble.  My wife's salad was good, had red onion, cherry tomatoes, cucumbers, and nice croutons in it.  A cut above your average dinner salad.  My soup, chicken tortilla, was possibly the best I have ever had, loaded with chicken in a fantastic tomato base.

My wife's lasagna was good, not great, but better than some more highly-priced places.  I had the spaghetti carbonara,  reasonably priced and it was good.  A lot of chicken and bacon.  Two days earlier I had the carbonara at Terra Verde at Green Valley Ranch Resort and Dean's was better.  

The kicker:  (sorry for the length).  We gave our coupon to Victoria.  She came back and said they couldn't accept it as it was not an original, it was printed out.  (it is exactly the same as the original, but did come from the RJ's website).
She told us it says they only accept originals.  We didn't understand why they let the RJ post their coupon online with a "Print this coupon" button.

She did the proper thing and politely said "I will get the manager".  He came out and just kept reiterating that it says they don't accept printed coupons on the coupon.  And he is right, it does say that in the very fine print.  Which we obviously did not read (it would require my reading glasses which I rarely even now where they are at)

The manager had an opportunity to turn a bad situation into a very good situation.  Instead of saying, "I will make an exception this time",  we were basically treated as people who were trying to rip Dean's Place off of $13. 

He had the opportunity to gain frequent customers for life.  Instead, we will never set foot in that restaurant again. 

 I went to their website as I thought I would drop an email to them recounting our visit.  Their website does not list an email address and the "contact us" form does not work.  Somebody needs to give a makeover to Dean's Place overall.  Yes, their phone number is listed.  But I didn't want to call.

One last note.  My wife left her sweater in the restaurant.  As we were getting in the car, our server, Victoria, came running outside with it.  It's too bad Victoria doesn't run that restaurant.

I was here last Tuesday for the second time. The first visit was about 4 years ago. The food quality is still the same as I remember. I had the white pizza, my husband had the rib eye and my dad had seafood tortellini. It was all okay, nothing special. The only thing we really enjoyed was the Italian Wedding soup. The service was a little slow but I think it's because there was only one server, which isn't her fault. Let's just say I feel I wouldn't go back unless someone wanted to treat me to dinner and they wanted to go...which is the reason I went back this time after not eating there for 4 years...its just okay and in this city that's not good enough.
The garlic balls are amazing. They're 5 star. Everything else is Ok. Don't bother with the Greek salad unless you like lettuce with olive oil poured on it.

This is a great local bar/restaurant.  They have a lot to offer on the menu, they always have specials and the prices are good. 

The bar is centrally locates with a dining area on both sides that are separated so your not being smoked on as your eat.   If your hungry you must try some of the pasta plates, a big salad or The Godfather ribeye which is awesome. 

Jack and Michelle are sure to take good care of you

This is our first experience with Dean's Place. We placed an order for pick up. An order of Chicken Parmesan, an order of Tortellini and an order of Fettuccine Alfredo. It was completely wrapped up upon pick up. Styrofoam boxes were wrapped in saran wrap. Upon arriving home and opening the boxes we were appalled at the portion received for our order of fettuccine Alfredo. I am including a picture for your reference. We placed it on a salad plate just so your aware of the actual size if the plate. Are you kidding me? And of course its not like this place is close to home for us to turn around and go back. Also, they do not include a soup or salad with their entree meals. That would cost extra so you would think the portions of food would be appropriate to price. We will not be going back to Dean's Place. This was our first and last time ordering food from them.

Terrific Reuben sandwich with lean brisket, slice of Swiss, crunchy sauerkraut and a to-die-for sauce.  10" pizza with onions, pepperoni and mushrooms had a crispy crust, tasty sauce and a light sprinkling of cheese.  We'll be back.

Ill start with the positives.
The service was great. Our server Nicole was friendly, fast and made sure we were taken care of.
The negative.
I ordered the Ribeye. Asking if the steak was thin or thick. I prefaced that I did not want the steak over cooked so I asked for rare to medium rare as thin steaks cook fast. My steak came out medium to medium well.  It was tough, had grissle. 
The Caesar Salad was fair at best. 
If it wasnt for having a great time with our friends celebrating a Birthday the evening would have been a bust.

I like to try new places and definitely ones that are not part of a national chain. We were craving Italian and find it oh so hard to find local/ mom & pop restaurants in town.  So we yelped a couple places nearby and decided on this one.  

We got there on the early side, around 1145 am, there wasn't really anybody here, YET. Sat in the non-smoking lounge that had plenty of Frank Sinatra on, tons of TV's, has a full bar, gaming, AND has an outside deck. Now there's not much to look at but when the weather gets nice I love to sit outside.  So far we were impressed.

Ordered Chicken Parm and my friend ordered meatball sub [under $10].  I started with Italian wedding soup [made with rice here not pasta] and it was very very good.  Chicken Parm was average, nothing to write home about, but wasn't bad by any means. Came with garlic bread and a huge side of pasta [and the soup] for $12.95.

Waitress was very funny pulled some jokes on us and was very attentive. Nice red-headed lady :). When we left there was about 5 other tables dining here and about 20 people up at the bar in the smoking room [aka it got pretty busy]. They have daily specials, graveyard specials, and a daily soup. 

Both of us agreed we'd go back.  It's easy to get to once you know where you are going, there's plenty of parking, it's reasonably priced, there's outside seating for nice days, and the music was very relaxing.

They also appear to be open 24/7 or dang near close to it

Did not enjoy my lunch here. The service was aloof and kind of rude even though we were one of two tables in there. 
I ordered a roasted red pepper chicken sandwich on ciabatta- it was soggy with grease from the 4 slices of melted cheese and did not taste at all good. The fries were even waaaay too greasy to eat.
It was made for a 280 lb alcoholic that only consumes food for the caloric value.
Sorry this place has Dino's name on it.

Garlic balls!   All I need to tell you is order the garlic balls.  They are tasty balls of bread sitting in a small pond of melted butter and enough garlic to combat an army of vampires.   I mean this is a super simple dish that is so satisfying.  

This is a gaming bar establishment with dining available on both sides of the enclosed bar area.  You have to deal with separate bills for food vs alcohol.   That is a small price to pay for solid food, some delightfully quirky servers and a very relaxed and laid back spot.  

Two of us had the Deans Burger and it was a proper burger.  Really enjoyed it and the side of fries.   The third member of our party ordered a pizza which was dispatched in short order.  We had a very chill dinner and left very relaxed and happy.   We will definitely return to Dean's Place because now it is one of our places!

This place is way over priced for the portion size that you get.  I left hungry and we had to stop on the way home in a drive through. I can't believe I wasted 80.00 for 4 people to eat. The pastas do not even come with a salad. They give dinner rolls instead of Italian bread. We will never return here. I will gladly pay $80.00 somewhere else like Bucca that has a real Italian menu with real Italian portions.

The service was good, but unfortunately the food was mediocre.  The best part of the meal was the salad and bread.  The lasagne was kind of small and way too dry.  The dining room was like a small banquet area with no personality or charm.

I am surprised to see the bad reviews and comments.

We have been here a bunch of times and have always enjoyed our dinners.
Everything we have ever ordered was really good,

My husband likes Italian food and he really enjoys the pasta dishes here as well as the bread they bring out.
Service is always really good too. They are always on top of everything,

There is a bar separated from the restaurant which is nice for anyone with a family that may want to go in,

No complaints and we would for sure go back.  Try it for yourself were sure you will enjoy!

Dean's Place is an institution in Las Vegas because of its fantastic venue opportunities. A large variety of seating options including patio, smoking bar, non-smoking bar, gambling, non gambling, and even take out. A menu that features Pizza burgers and pasta and probably the best breakfast on the southwest side of town, if not all of Las Vegas. This is a family style restaurant run by a core group of employees who might as well be married and part of a family together anyway they are so wonderful. If you're thirsty hungry or just looking for a good time, this is your kind of place.

I had never been here before, and thought it was high time that I had.  Although we were the only diners present at 6:30 p.m. on a Sunday night, the food was clearly freshly made, and quite well prepared.  Bacon-wrapped Shrimp dipped in Sweet Chili Sauce and triangles of Fried Mozzarella were nice starters, and Italian Wedding Soup with medium-sized rather than tiny meatballs was a suitable accompaniment.  Caesar Salad was good but desired anchovies were not available.  And garlic-supported Linguini & Clams was a fine finish, except I had to dodge two pieces of shell near the end.  

Service was quite attentive and friendly, and the informal dining room setting conducive to an enjoyable dining experience.  I expect to be back!
My husband and 7 year old girls had dinner and it was delicious! Everyone's plate was devoured! Thank you!

Thumbs up for the $50 match play offer & big thumbs down for being rude about paying out winnings for the match play!
I took my family here to take advantage of the match play, and we got attitude for winning!
Not good, so not good. They obviously don't want people to "take their money", as we heard an employee say (a manager, I think). Oy vay.

I'm being generous and giving two stars because this actually is a nice looking restaurant. I have eaten here several times and the food was always acceptable at best. However in the last two times I have been in there the food you can tell is made from frozen product it's not fresh very cheap ingredients. BlAND.. Which is what you get with frozen product..   For what they charge go down the block to town square and go eat at Brio you will be much happier.
Excellent Italian food and there ribs on Wednesday  are out of this world! If you want a place with a beautiful atmosphere ,great food and service go to Deans place! I give it 5 stars!
